meanings.definition: The long threadlike part of a nerve cell along which impulses are conducted.
meanings.sent1: The axon carries messages from one part of the nerve cell to another.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the axon helps transmit signals in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The axon was like a busy road with signals rushing through.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled down the axon like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent5: The axon is like a messenger delivering urgent news to the brain.

meanings.definition: A nerve fiber that conducts impulses away from the cell body of a neuron.
meanings.sent1: The axon carries information away from the neuron's cell body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how the axon transmits signals in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The axon decided to take a vacation from its nerve cell.
meanings.sent4: The axon stretched out like a bridge connecting different parts of the brain.
meanings.sent5: The axon's job is to relay messages like a dedicated messenger.
